title: In a first, India set to bag 100+ medals in Para Asiad
description: India is on track to achieve its best-ever performance at the Asian Para Games, with a projected 100 medals. The athletes are expected to secure more medals in para athletics, chess, and rowing events. India has already surpassed its previous records, with a total of 99 medals, including 25 golds. Female athletes have won 37 of these medals. The government's financial intervention and emphasis on sports science have played a crucial role in India's success.

title: Interpol notice on 20-yr-old rival of Bishnoi in the US
description: Interpol has issued a 'red notice' against gangster Yogesh Kadiyan, a rival of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who is believed to be in the US. Yogesh, who works for the Bambiha syndicate, is considered a weapons expert and has close links with arms suppliers in the US and pro-Khalistan elements. Indian agencies are coordinating with their US counterparts to locate and apprehend him. The Bambiha syndicate is planning to take down the Lawrence Bishnoi network and establish their dominance in the US and Canada.

title: Engineers line up for 'cycle test' to become peons
description: Scores of BTech holders and graduates in Kerala's Ernakulam queued up to apply for a government office peon job, despite requiring only a Class 7 qualification and the ability to ride a bicycle. The job offers a monthly salary of around Rs 23,000 and is seen as more secure than gig economy jobs. The cycling test is still a requirement, although it serves no practical purpose, and 101 candidates have cleared the test and now face an endurance test.

title: Super Mafia: Rising concerns as Italy's top three gang godfathers seen sharing meal
description: Italian authorities have captured footage of the leaders of Italy's three most powerful organized crime groups - the Ndrangheta, Camorra, and Cosa Nostra - sharing a meal, raising concerns of a potential alliance. Prosecutors believe that these once-rival criminal organizations have set aside their differences to form a grand alliance, exploiting business opportunities in Italy's prosperous north. The mafia groups have shifted their focus to white-collar crime and legitimate investments, funneling drug trafficking profits into various sectors.

title: UN General Assembly adopts resolution calling for Gaza ceasefire
description: The United Nations General Assembly has adopted a non-binding resolution calling for a ceasefire in Gaza. The resolution received overwhelming support with 120 votes in favor, 14 against, and 45 abstentions. Notably, the resolution does not mention the Hamas terror group. Countries such as the United States, Israel, and Austria voted against the resolution, while countries including India, Canada, and the UK abstained. Israel criticized the vote, calling it an "infamy" and accusing the international community of supporting "Nazi terrorists.

title: Siberian battalion: The new Ukraine unit formed entirely of Russians
description: A new "Siberian Battalion" has been formed by Russian nationals who have defected from Putin's army to fight alongside Ukrainian forces in the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. The battalion includes prominent members such as Alexei Makarov and Ildar Dadin. The exact location and impact of the battalion remain undisclosed, but their presence could complicate matters for Putin's forces, who have already suffered significant losses in the conflict.

title: South Africa edge Pakistan in World Cup thriller
description: South Africa survived a late charge from Pakistan to pull off a thrilling 1-wicket win and move closer to the semis of the World Cup on Friday. Aiden Markram hit a solid 91 and at 206-4 South Africa were well on course to comfortably chase down a 271-run target. However, it was left to the last pair of Keshav Maharaj and Tabraiz Shamsi to score 11 runs, who took their side across the finish line with 16 balls to spare.

title: WATCH: Haris Rauf takes a one-handed stunner off his own bowling
description: Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf grabbed a stunning one-handed catch off his own bowling to dismiss South Africa tailender Lungi Ngidi during their ICC ODI World Cup match at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. Rauf, who was bowling his 10th and final over of his spell, bowled a good length delivery. Ngidi looked to flick but got a leading edge. Rauf dived forward, managed to get his left hand underneath the ball and grabbed a one-handed blinder to take the crucial wicket.

title: Clash breaks out in Bihar's Saran, internet services suspended
description: At least six people were injured when a clash broke out during a procession for immersion of Goddess Durga’s idols in Bihar’s Saran district on Friday morning, the third such incident in the past three days.

title: Man kills sister for 'honour', buries body in riverbed
description: Police said Neelam Kumari, 15, a resident of Laukaha police station area, had gone out to offer prayers to a local temple in the evening of October 21 when she went mysteriously missing.

title: Canada introduces reforms to protect international students
description: Canada's Minister of Immigration, Marc Miller, has announced measures to protect international students and strengthen the integrity of the international student program. These measures include verifying acceptance letters from educational institutions and adopting a 'recognized institution' framework for post-secondary Designated Learning Institutions. The aim is to ensure that study permits are issued only against genuine acceptance letters and to provide better services and support for international students.

title: Boris Johnson to host right-wing news show
description: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to join GB News as a presenter, alongside other Conservative politicians. His role will involve covering the UK general election and the upcoming US elections. While the exact salary is unknown, it is expected to be a substantial six-figure sum. GB News has recently faced controversies and suspended presenters, but Johnson's appointment is unrelated to these issues. He expressed his excitement to share his unfiltered views on the channel, discussing topics such as global challenges and opportunities for the UK.

title: 'Liking obscene content on social media no crime, sharing is'
description: However, the act of sharing or reposting such content will lead to legal consequences. The court, in its ruling on Wednesday, explained that sharing such a post falls under the category of "transmission" as per Section 67 of the Information Technology (IT) Act, and will be subject to penalties.

title: Exclusive! Sagar Parekh aka Samar reveals the real reason behind his exit from Anupamaa; says "It was because of the..."
description: Actor Sagar Parekh, who recently exited the show Anupamaa, revealed that the reason behind his departure was the dropping TRP and the need for a storyline shake-up. He mentioned that the show had been on top for three years, but with over 1,000 episodes, it becomes challenging to keep bringing new content. Sagar expressed his support for the decision, stating that he would always back a storyline that supports the overall story and is executed well.

title: Canada announces new rules to curb international student fraud schemes
Ivanka ordered to testify in Donald Trump's fraud case
description: Ivanka Trump has been ordered by a New York judge to testify in the ongoing civil fraud lawsuit against her father, former President Donald Trump, and his real estate company. Ivanka had requested to strike down the subpoena for her testimony, but the judge ruled in favor of the New York Attorney General. The trial, now in its fourth week, alleges that Donald Trump inflated his assets in financial documents.

title: Watch: Stokes, Livingstone had lucky escape in Delhi
description: England all-rounder Ben Stokes disclosed that he along with fellow player Liam Livingstone narrowly avoided an accident while riding in an auto-rickshaw in Delhi.

title: Rail infra overhaul in UP ahead of Ayodhya temple opening
description: Following inspection and review meeting with officials of Lucknow division on Friday, the General Manager Northern Railway (NR), Shobhan Chaudhuri informed TOI, that in next two months the division has set a target to complete doubling of rail track originating or heading towards Ayodhya.

title: Usama Mir first-ever concussion substitute in WC history
description: Pakistan cricketer Usama Mir became the first-ever concussion substitute in World Cup history. Mir took the field after Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan suffered a head injury during their World Cup fixture against South Africa on Friday. Shadab was replaced by spinner Mir as the concussion substitute. The incident took place in the first over of South Africa's chase. Shadab, in an attempt to run out Quinton de Kock, ended up landing awkwardly on his head and shoulder, requiring immediate medical attention.

title: 'Concocted story': Raj priest rejects Priyanka remark on PM
description: The BJP's complaint highlighted Priyanka Gandhi's public statement during a meeting in Dausa on October 20, where she mentioned that she had seen on TV that when an envelope of donation made by Modi at a temple was opened, it contained only Rs 21. She clarified that she had seen the news and wasn't aware of the veracity of the claim.

title: Delhi's air quality poor for fifth day in row
description: The 24-hour average Air Quality Index (AQI) for the city was recorded at 261, which is a deterioration from 256 on Thursday, 243 on Wednesday, and 220 on Tuesday.

title: WATCH: Pakistan's Wasim does a MS Dhoni vs South Africa
description: The Chennai crowd is always in awe of the legendary Mahendra Singh Dhoni. A glimpse of the former Indian captain was witnessed during the ICC ODI World Cup match between Pakistan and South Africa when the Pakistan batsman Mohammad Wasim junior provided Chepauk fans with a memorable moment. The tailender executed a 'helicopter shot', a signature shot of the 2011 World Cup-winning captain.

title: ED freezes bank accounts of arrested Bengal minister Jyotipriya
description: The ED has instructed bank authorities to freeze the accounts of the minister, his wife, and daughter and is also investigating whether there are additional bank accounts associated with the minister or his family.

title: Interpol issues Red corner notice for Haryana's Yogesh Kadian
College dropout 'doctor' held in 151kg drug bust
description: After a 10-day chase from Mumbai to Nashik to Uttar Pradesh to Uttarakhand, a 27-year-old college dropout was finally arrested, on Thursday, 100km away from Dehradun in the 151kg mephedrone drug haul case that the Saki Naka police busted on October 6.

title: Chandrababu Naidu will die in 2024: Hindupur MP
description: The Telugu Desam party has vehemently condemned Gorantla Madhav's remarks and alleged that his comments reflect the conspiracy being hatched by the ruling YSRCP government to physically eliminate Chandrababu Naidu.

title: Watch: Bumrah bowls left-arm, Jadeja right-arm
description: Team India underwent a lively training session in Lucknow ahead of the ODI World Cup match against England to be played at the Ekana Stadium on Sunday. What particularly caught the eyes was the playful display by pacer Jasprit Bumrah, leg-spinner Kuldeep Yadav and Ravindra Jadeja, who amused their teammates by bowling with their non-dominant hands. Star India batter Virat Kohli along with many other batters were also seen trying their hands with the ball in the nets.

title: Next year not optimistic for Indian auto sector: Bhargava
description: While going forward, focusing on driving small car sales is a key point of concern for MSIL, according to Bhargava this will not be achieved quickly. He stressed the importance of the segment by saying, “We still have 2 or 3 years before the small car market can revive, if it does not, then sustained growth at the current levels may not even last 6 to 7 years.”

title: This transgender mayor set to contest from Raigarh
description: Madhu Bai Kinnar, the first transgender mayor in the industrial town of Raigarh, has announced her candidacy for the upcoming assembly elections as a representative of the regional party Janta Congress Chhattisgarh.

title: Arrested WB min Jyotipriya faints inside courtroom
description: The state's forest minister fainted during the court hearing and was subsequently taken out to a balcony where he was provided with water to drink.

title: Harbhajan calls Buttler 'clueless', says England not capable of beating India
description: Defending champions England were pushed to the brink of World Cup elimination on Thursday when they were handed an eight-wicket thrashing by Sri Lanka in their crucial ICC ODI World Cup match at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru on Thursday. England now have four defeats and just one victory and need to win their remaining four matches to maintain their slender hope of sneaking into the semi-finals. Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh came down hard on the 2019 champions and called their captain Jos Buttler 'clueless'.

title: Tata to become first Indian iPhone maker
description: Tata Group is set to become India's first homegrown iPhone maker after agreeing to purchase Wistron Corp's iPhone assembly plant in southern India for $125 million. The acquisition comes as Tata seeks to strengthen its ties with Apple. The deal is subject to regulatory approvals. Tata has also increased hiring at its factory in Hosur and plans to launch 100 Apple stores in India.

title: Gill focuses on short ball play, long tail prepares to wag
description: Shubman Gill dedicated his focus to improving his performance against short-pitched deliveries as seven Indian cricketers endured the intense Lucknow sun, preparing for their upcoming World Cup clash against England, just two days away.

title: India's IT sector raises red flags over proposed changes to H-1B visa rules
description: The Indian IT sector, represented by Nasscom, has expressed concerns about certain aspects of the proposed rule for H-1B visa modernization released by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). The tightening of requirements for H-1B 'specialty occupations' and other hurdles could make it difficult for companies to hire skilled workers. However, there are positive changes in the proposed rule that aim to streamline the H-1B process and provide more flexibility for applicants.

title: Kannada teacher bringing change in Mumbai for 30 yrs
description: Amaresh Patil, a 60-year-old retired government high school teacher from Mumbai, has gone above and beyond his teaching duties by educating slum children in Kannada language for three decades.

title: 'Ration scam': ED arrests Bengal minister Jyotipriyo Mallick
description: This action was taken under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act after more than 17-18 hours of questioning. Mallick, who is a diabetic patient with various ailments, was apprehended at his residence in the Salt Lake area on the outskirts of Kolkata and brought to the ED's office at 3:30 am.

title: Sponge bombs: How Israel plans to tackle Hamas ‘terror metro’
description: Israeli forces are facing a formidable challenge in the form of the Hamas 'terror metro', a network of tunnels used by Hamas fighters in Gaza. The tunnels are hidden underground, full of traps, and heavily reinforced with concrete. US officials have warned Israel of the difficulties in breaching the tunnels and the likelihood of suffering casualties. Recognizing the need for an efficient solution, Israel is testing 'sponge bombs' that use a chemical reaction to seal off tunnel openings. These bombs could prevent ambushes and secure the tunnels during ground invasions.

title: Want to study abroad without IELTS? Here are the countries and universities to opt for
description: Proving proficiency in English is a major requirement for studying at top universities. Exams like IELTS and TOEFL are essential for international students. However, there are universities in the UK, Canada, the US, and Germany that offer programs without requiring IELTS scores. Check out these universities here in the article below.

title: 'Like a spider's web': Hamas' underground city a big challenge to Israel's ground offensive
description: Israeli tanks and military forces are preparing to invade Gaza, but they face a significant challenge in the form of a vast network of tunnels beneath the coastal strip. The tunnels, estimated to be at least 8 meters underground, are used for smuggling, storage, and as a base for launching attacks. US officials have warned that breaching the tunnel network will be extremely difficult and result in mass casualties. Despite efforts to detect and destroy the tunnels, Hamas still maintains operational connections to the outside world.

title: WATCH : Jansen throws verbal volleys, Rizwan offers a hug
description: South Africa's young pacer Marco Jansen unleashed a barrage of verbal volleys at Pakistan batsman Mohammad Rizwan during their ICC ODI World Cup match at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. Rizwan scored 31 runs off 27 balls before being dismissed by Gerald Coetzee. Rizwan completed 2,000 one-day international runs when he opened his account with a boundary off fast bowler Jansen after Pakistan opted to bat at the Chidambaram Stadium. Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bat against South Africa in their must-win World Cup clash.

title: Gangsters Act: Mukhtar Ansari gets 10-yr jail
description: An MP/MLA court in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district sentenced gangster-turned politician Mukhtan Ansari to 10 years in jail in a case related to Gangsters Act.

title: Average gross total income for individual taxpayers rises to Rs 7L
description: The average gross total income of individual taxpayers in India has witnessed a significant increase, according to the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT). In assessment year 2021-22, the average gross total income rose by 56% to Rs 7 lakh, a considerable jump from Rs 4.5 lakh in assessment year 2013-14.

title: Putin dead, coup in Moscow? Kremlin refutes new rumours
description: A Telegram channel known for spreading misinformation has claimed that Russian President Vladimir Putin is dead and a coup is underway in Moscow. This comes after previous claims by the channel that Putin had suffered a heart attack. Despite the dubious nature of the source, media reports have picked up on the information, prompting the Kremlin to issue clarifications. Putin's spokesman has dismissed the claims as "absurd information canard" and stated that the president is in good health.

title: England's run worst in WC history for a defending champion
description: England began with a mauling at the hand of last edition's runners up New Zealand, who won by nine wickets. They won their next match against Bangladesh, but since then have failed to cross the 215-run mark in three matches, resulting in three crushing defeats, including an upset against Afghanistan. Against South Africa and Sri Lanka, the title holders couldn't even reach 200. The four defeats in first five matches is now a record for a team defending its title in an ODI World Cup.

title: Delhi court extends judicial custody Sanjay Singh till Nov 10
description: A Delhi court on Friday extended the judicial custody of AAP leader Sanjay Singh in excise policy case till November 10.

title: Cash-for-query: Can't depose before panel on Oct 31, Mahua says
description: "I am already committed to attending numerous pre-scheduled Vijaya Dashami sammelans/meetings (both government and political) in my constituency from October 30-November 4, 2023. I cannot be in Delhi on October 31," Mahua Moitra wrote in the letter addressed to the chairperson of the Lok Sabha Ethics Committee. She represents Krishnanagar constituency of West Bengal. The TMC MP requested the Lok Sabha ethics panel to give her any date after November 5 to appear in person.

title: Apple iPhone 15's problems with wireless charging in Toyota, BMW cars
description: Users affected by this issue have been receiving a "Could Not Set Up Apple Pay" error message even though they have already set up Apple Pay.

title: Pak's car crisis gets worse: 3 companies shut shop
description: Out of the three car brands, Indus Motor/Toyota has shut production for the longest period of one month. On the other hand, Suzuki halted operations for just two days and Honda cars will not be produced for six days, ending on October 31. Moreover, fresh reports from Pakistani media suggest that manufacturing licenses of three additional car manufacturers have now been suspended after they were unable to achieve their export targets.

title: Dhoni reveals when he had decided to retire from int'l cricket
description: Former Indian cricket captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni revealed his decision to retire from international cricket after India's heartbreaking defeat to New Zealand in the 2019 World Cup semifinal. He officially announced his retirement on August 15, 2020. Dhoni's silence and absence from the cricketing arena for 13 months following India's exit from the World Cup left fans and the cricketing world speculating about his future.

title: HP CM flown to AIIMS-Delhi for 2nd opinion, stable
description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu has been admitted to AIIMS in New Delhi for a stomach infection. He is currently being evaluated by a team of doctors led by Dr. Pramod Garg. The Chief Minister is suffering from mild to moderate acute pancreatitis but is in a stable condition. The transfer to AIIMS was done for a second opinion and to ensure the best possible care and treatment.

title: Read Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella’s letter on the company’s leadership change
description: Microsoft is experiencing leadership changes in its marketing and Xbox divisions. CEO Satya Nadella has communicated with Microsoft employees about changes in the marketing team. Yusuf Mehdi has been promoted to handle a larger portfolio at the company, while Chris Capossela is leaving after 32 years. Takeshi Numoto is being promoted to Chief Marketing Officer, and Yusuf Mehdi will serve as Executive Vice President, Consumer Chief Marketing Officer.

title: 14-yr-old girl pedals 35km to hosp to save dad
description: A 14-year-old girl from Odisha's Bhadrak district pedalled a trolley rickshaw for 35 km to take her injured father to the district headquarters hospital (DHH). Sujata Sethi, the girl, initially took her father to a nearby hospital but was advised to transfer him to Bhadrak DHH. Determined to get her father the necessary medical attention, she pedalled the trolley to bring him to the district hospital. The inspiring story has garnered much attention and support from the local authorities and community members.

title: Indians will have to pay $1,000 tax to visit this country
description: El Salvador has introduced a $1,000 (0ver Rs 8,000) fee for passengers from Africa or India in an attempt to limit migration to the US via the country. The fee will be used to improve the nation's main international airport. This comes as the US Customs and Border Patrol recorded a record 3.2 million migrants across the country in fiscal year 2023. Airlines will need to inform Salvadoran authorities daily of passengers from the affected countries.

title: Mom forced to leave, boy stabs dad to death
description: A 16-year-old boy in Jharkhand's Palamu district allegedly stabbed his father to death after his mother was forced to leave their home. The incident occurred in Pakriya village, where the victim, Chotu Sharma, resided. Upset by his father's actions, the minor took matters into his own hands and fatally stabbed him. The accused fled the scene after committing the crime. The mother sought refuge at her parents' home in Chainpur. The incident was witnessed by the accused boy's paternal cousin.

title: Chandrayaan-3: Vikram kicked up over 2-tonne lunar soil
description: The Vikram lander of Chandrayaan-3 created a "reflectance anomaly" or "ejecta halo" when it touched down on the Moon's surface on August 23. Scientists estimate that about 2.06 tonnes of lunar epi-regolith were ejected and displaced over an area of 108.4 m² around the landing site. By studying high-resolution images from the Chandrayaan-2 orbiter, researchers were able to characterize the ejecta halo. This discovery provides insights into lunar geology and the impact of lunar landings on the surface.

title: Ind vs Eng: Team India faces dilemma over bowling options
description: India's strategy for their upcoming match against England in the ICC ODI World Cup is uncertain due to the unavailability of all-rounder Hardik Pandya. Typically playing at number six and as third seamer, Hardik's absence has created a challenging situation for the Indian team management. Despite making two changes to their lineup in Dharamsala, India secured their fifth consecutive win. With Hardik, India has six bowling options, but in his absence, they are expected to field five bowlers against struggling England.

title: Eye-bleeding virus detected in France: Is Britain next?
description: This disease, which is related to the infamous Ebola virus, is prevalent in regions such as Africa, the Middle East, Asia, and the Balkans. It has occasionally been detected in southern parts of Western Europe, including Spain. Experts have consistently warned that climate change could push this disease further north into Europe, and even Britain might be vulnerable, a Daily Mail report said. The World Health Organization (WHO) has classified CCHF as one of its nine priority diseases this year due to the potential threat it poses.

title: Top IT giants may cut salary hikes by half as slump hurts
description: In FY23, when the IT sector was still thriving, average increments ranged from 12% to 18%. However, for the current year, these increments are projected to be in the range of 6% to 10%

title: Ambani children get shareholder nod for appointment on Reliance board
description: Reliance Industries' shareholders have approved the appointment of Isha Ambani, Akash Ambani, and Anant Ambani as Non-Executive Directors. This development is an important step in implementing Reliance's succession plans.

title: Malayalam art director Sabu Pravadas passes away following injuries in a road accident
description: Renowned Malayalam art director Sabu Pravadas passed away after a 10-day battle following a road accident. Known for his exceptional work in the industry, he collaborated on many successful movies, including 'Rajavinte Makan' and 'Run Baby Run.' His contributions extended beyond art direction, as he also received recognition for his literary work and design at the International Film Festival of Kerala. Sabu Pravadas' artistic touch graced numerous films and he will be remembered for his creative prowess.

title: Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi jet off to Tuscany for their wedding!
description: Tollywood stars Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi have started their journey to their wedding destination in Italy. The couple was spotted at the airport, accompanied by Panja Vaishnav Tej and Niharika Konidela. The wedding festivities will begin on October 30 with a pre-wedding cocktail party. The leaked wedding invitation reveals a silver and gold theme, with blessings mentioned from various family members including Chiranjeevi, Pawan Kalyan, and Ram Charan. Ram Charan and his family have already arrived in Tuscany for the wedding.

title: After 5G, India aims to lead in 6G as well, PM Modi says
description: PM Modi on Friday inaugurated the 7th Edition of the India Mobile Congress at the recently-launched Bharat Mandapam. "We are not only expanding 5G in the country but also moving in the direction of becoming leaders in the area of 6G technology," he said while speaking at the forum. The PM also used the platform to take a dig the UPA government over the 2G spectrum scam. "Everyone knows what happened during the 2G (spectrum allocation under the UPA govt). During our government, 4G was expanded but there was no stain on us," he said.

title: Delhi cop tossed in air as SUV hits him at Connaught Place
WC: 'Spoil India's party' - Nasser Hussain urges England
description: While maintaining that the players can't be "given a cop out" by blaming the "structure of English cricket" when the "wheels come off", former England captain Hussain urged Jos Buttler's team to bring their best game on the park this Sunday to "spoil India's party". In contrast to England's dismal show, two-time champions India have been on a roll, winning all their five matches so far. After India on Sunday, England will have matches left against Australia, Netherlands and Pakistan.

title: Race to fix Philippines ship threatens conflict in South China Sea
description: Tensions between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea have escalated as the two countries clash over a dilapidated ship that serves as the Philippines' outpost in the disputed Second Thomas Shoal. China has accused the Philippines of infringing on its territorial sovereignty, while the Philippines is seeking to reinforce its territorial claims. The situation has the potential to drag the US into direct conflict with China, making the South China Sea more dangerous than the Taiwan Strait, according to experts.

title: Why Denmark is demolishing 'non-Western' neighborhoods
description: Denmark, a Scandinavian country known for its progressive policies and high standard of living, has recently come under the spotlight for its decision to demolish what it terms as 'non-Western' neighborhoods. This move has raised eyebrows and sparked debates on integration, cultural preservation, and the broader implications for immigrant communities in Denmark. ​The plan was introduced in 2018 by a conservative government, but it has been supported by the current Social Democratic government as well.

title: 'Retired' MS Dhoni hints at IPL participation in 2024
description: MS Dhoni, former Indian cricket captain and World Cup-winning skipper, has updated about his ongoing rehabilitation after knee surgery and hinted at his return to the Indian Premier League in 2024. Dhoni led the Chennai Super Kings to their fifth IPL title in 2023, but his persistent knee issues limited his batting contributions. He revealed that his knee surgery was successful and he is making steady progress without complications.

title: Why Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone make us believe that in this chaotic, messy world,
description: For starters, the duo could not have been more different from each other, with Deepika exclaiming that she is married to Rocky Randhawa in real-life! A loud, boisterous, full of life Sindhi boy falls in love and marries a South Indian girl, (as her father would say from a 'boring' family) - poised, polished and daughter of one of the most well known sports personalities in the country. Yet as cliche as that might sound, the duo fell passionately in love and Ranveer proposed marriage before someone else could!

title: G-Dragon on drugs controversy: There is no truth to claim that I have taken drugs
description: K-Pop singer G-Dragon has denied allegations of being involved in a drugs controversy. The popular artist issued a statement through his legal team, stating that he has no connection to the substance abuse scandal that has affected the Korean entertainment industry. G-Dragon has promised to extend co-operation to to the police investigations.

title: IMC 2023: Jio chairman Akash Ambani showcases JioSpaceFiber capabilities to PM Modi
description: Reliance Jio has demonstrated India's first satellite-based giga fibre service, called JioSpaceFiber, at the India Mobile Congress. The service aims to provide high-speed broadband access to previously inaccessible areas across the country at affordable prices. Jio is partnering with SES to access medium earth orbit satellite technology, making it the only company in the industry to offer this service. The satellite network will also enhance the availability and scale of Jio's True5G in remote regions. Four locations have already been connected with JioSpaceFiber.

title: World Cup: Who stands where in the race to semifinals
description: All 10 participating teams have played five matches each, and six wins in nine round-robin matches can be considered safe, while seven wins likely to guarantee a place in the knockouts. The closest to that six-win mark are hosts India, who have won all their five matches so far. Among the big teams staring at an early exit, England and Pakistan face must-win situations against India and South Africa, respectively, in their next matches to keep their semifinal hopes alive.

title: World Cup: The art of chasing 400 while batting first on flat tracks
description: In the world of white-ball cricket, teams batting first are under pressure to put up huge totals on placid tracks. The pressure to score 400 runs is real, requiring a solid platform, intent through the middle overs, and a powerful finish. England set the standard for high scores in the last six years but failed to execute their all-or-nothing approach in the current World Cup. Australia and South Africa have shown the importance of partnerships and working through gears to construct big scores.

title: India ramps up border drone defense after Hamas attack on Israel
description: India is planning to set up a surveillance system using drones across its borders to prevent surprise attacks. Defense officials have met with local drone vendors and an announcement is expected next month. The system, which will use High-Altitude Pseudo Satellites, will be operational in some parts of the border by May. The move comes as tensions with neighboring China and Pakistan persist, and the country aims to strengthen its border security.

title: IPL player auction on Dec 19 in Dubai: Report
description: The auction is reportedly scheduled to be held in Dubai, which will be the first instance of an IPL auction being held overseas. As per the report, the purse for each franchise has been increased to Rs 100 crore, which is a raise of Rs 5 crore compared to last season, while the teams have been given the deadline of November 15 to release their lists of retained and released players. The Indian team will be on its tour of South Africa at that time.

title: Assam reminds staff: 'Take permission before marrying if....'
description: The state of Assam in India has reminded its employees of a rule that prohibits them from entering into a second marriage if their spouse is still alive, without government approval. The rule applies even if bigamy is allowed under personal laws. Violation of this rule can result in penalties including compulsory retirement. This reminder comes as Assam plans to ban polygamy and cracks down on child marriages.

title: Muslim league holds massive pro-Palestine rally in Kerala
description: Tens of thousands of people gathered at Kozhikode beach for a pro-Palestine rally organized by the IUML. Chanting slogans and holding banners, activists expressed solidarity with Palestine. IUML leader Panakkad Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal criticized Israel, accusing it of being a terrorist nation. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor, the chief guest, referred to Hamas as terrorists, which sparked a response from IUML leader M K Muneer. Tharoor condemned the Israeli bombings as disproportionate, while Muneer emphasized the fight for independence by Palestinians. Tharoor stressed that the rally was not just a Muslim issue but a human rights issue.

title: How this gang made a killing in name of providing quick visas
description: Delhi Police's crime branch has arrested three men for running a visa processing fraud in Delhi, Punjab, and neighbouring states. The syndicate had set up multiple shell companies with fictitious employees to deceive victims into paying exorbitant fees for visa processing. The police have identified over 1,000 victims nationwide. The accused have been charged with forging documents and stamps from international banks. The police gathered evidence including call records, application forms, and bank statements during the investigation. The arrested individuals have been remanded in judicial custody.

title: MP elections: Neta rides donkey to file nomination
description: An independent candidate from Burhanpur assembly seat in Madhya Pradesh rode a donkey to the tehsil office to submit his nomination form. The candidate, Priyank Singh Thakur, accused politicians of fooling the public and said he wanted to send a clear message that voters should not be fooled by a few families in power. Thakur was seeking the BJP's ticket but filed his nomination as an independent after being denied. He plans to focus on development, poverty, and exposing corruption in his election campaign.

title: MP elections: This season, campaign material goes chic
‘Got Hema Malini to dance’: MP minister Narottam Mishra
description: Madhya Pradesh home minister Narottam Mishra has faced backlash for his comments about getting actress Hema Malini to dance at a public meeting while discussing his achievements. The video of his statement was shared on social media by Congress leader Digvijaya Singh, who criticized Mishra's behavior towards women. Mishra, who is contesting the Datia assembly seat, made the comments while highlighting the developments in his constituency. Hema Malini, a BJP Lok Sabha MP, is a Padma Shri awardee and a well-known actress in Bollywood.

title: F1 Mexico City GP: Qualifying, race time & where to watch
description: For the 20th round of the 2023 season, Formula One heads to the 4.304 km long Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez in Mexico City for the Mexican Grand Prix (currently held under the name Mexico City GP) - the home race for Red Bull's Sergio Perez.

title: 4-yr-old falls into pot of hot milk in Gwalior, dies
India keeps close watch on Chinese warships, submarine in Indian Ocean Region
description: The Chinese and Pakistan navies are slated to conduct the "Sea Guardians" joint maritime exercise in the northern Arabian Sea in November. A Chinese anti-piracy escort force (APEF) of a destroyer, a frigate and a tanker in the Persian Gulf region have been joined by a Song-class diesel-electric submarine along with a support vessel for the forthcoming exercise, sources said. Chinese spy vessels, packed with large antennae, advanced sensors and electronic equipment, undertake snooping, monitor satellite launches and track trajectories of ballistic missiles test-fired by India in the IOR.

title: Part of Eden Gardens wall collapses 2 days before WC match
Doc loses Rs 1cr in crypto trading scam, goes to cops after a yr
description: A 46-year-old doctor from Mumbai lost Rs 1.1 crore after being scammed by a woman he met online. The woman claimed to be an expert in cryptocurrency trading and convinced the doctor to invest his money based on her guidance. The doctor created a trading account and purchased various cryptocurrencies as instructed. However, when he tried to redeem his profits, he was asked to pay taxes and commissions. The doctor eventually realized he had been scammed and reported the incident to the police. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Bite that: Dog attack every 15 minutes in Lucknow
description: Stray animals in Lucknow, India are causing a significant number of animal bite incidents, with dogs being the main culprits. Stray dogs are responsible for biting approximately one person every 15 minutes, followed by monkeys and cats. Other animals such as horses, donkeys, and rodents also contribute to these statistics. Over 12,600 people received anti-rabies vaccines in the past month due to dog bites. Areas like Chowk, Thakurganj, and Aliganj are most affected. Monkeys are also causing disturbances in several localities. The local authorities and residents are struggling to address this issue.

title: Pakistan face do-or-die battle against South Africa
description: Pakistan cricket is facing a potential disaster as they are on the verge of being eliminated from the World Cup. Their recent loss to Afghanistan has put them in a difficult position, and their upcoming match against South Africa doesn't instill much confidence. However, Pakistan have a history of making remarkable comebacks, as seen in their 1992 World Cup victory. The current team, though, lacks the same skill level. The pressure is mounting on captain Babar Azam, and changes in the team are expected.

title: China ex-Premier Li Keqiang, sidelined by Xi Jinping, dies at 68
description: Former Premier Li Keqiang, who served as China's chief economic officer for ten years, passed away at the age of 68 due to a heart attack. Li's influence waned as President Xi Jinping consolidated power, exerting greater control over the nation's economy. Under Xi's leadership, state industries became more dominant, and there was increased control over tech sectors. Li's tenure saw challenges such as over-reliance on investments for growth and wealth disparity.

title: Bengal minister Jyotipriya Mallick arrested in ration 'scam'
description: Jyotipriya Mallick’s arrest comes a day after the Central probe agency conducted searches at the minister's residence in Salt Lake, on the outskirts of Kolkata.

title: Punjab minister to marry Meerut doctor
description: Punjab Sports Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer is set to marry radiologist Dr Gurveen Kaur from Meerut, Uttar Pradesh. The wedding will take place in Chandigarh on November 7, followed by a reception in Kararon village. Meet Hayer, a second-time MLA from the Aam Aadmi Party, has previously served as the education minister. Gurveen Kaur's family migrated from West Punjab and her father is an office-bearer of the Indian Olympics Association. Several other AAP MLAs have also recently tied the knot.

title: Gmail storage full: 6 simple tips to free up space
description: Gmail is the world's most popular email service, offering 15GB of free storage shared across all Google services. To save storage space, users can delete old emails, utilize filters to organize emails, avoid attaching large files, empty spam and trash folders, and use cloud storage services for large files. Additionally, unsubscribing from unwanted newsletters and emails can reduce inbox clutter.

title: Cdr Pakala crossed equator twice on Navy's sole sail ship
description: Commander Sugunakar Pakala, one of the eight former Indian naval officers facing a death sentence in Qatar, has had an impressive career and achieved the milestone of crossing the equator twice on INS Tarangini. His family and friends in Visakhapatnam are shocked by the court's decision and are hoping for his release before his birthday. Sugunakar joined the Navy at 18 and had a successful career before retiring in 2013. He was working for Al Dahra Global Technologies when he was arrested.

title: Robbers force man to transfer Rs 98k, kill him
description: A 24-year-old bank employee in Aligarh, India, was beaten to death by robbers who forced him to transfer ₹98,000 from his account. The incident occurred on October 21 while the victim was returning home. After discovering the decomposed body, police arrested seven suspects who admitted to the crime. The accused individuals, aged between 18 and 22 years, confessed to beating the victim with sticks and bricks.

title: Hooliganism, fumes Gehlot. Running scared, retorts BJP
description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot accused the BJP of using the Enforcement Directorate (ED) as a political tool to target its rivals. Gehlot made these comments after his son was summoned in a case under the Foreign Exchange Management Act and the ED raided the homes of the state Congress chief. Gehlot referred to the ED as an "electoral locust" that is deployed by the BJP when the party's defeat is inevitable. The raids on the Congress leader's residences were part of the ED's investigation into paper leaks during government recruitment exams.

title: Priyanka, Himanta get EC notices for remarks
description: The Election Commission has issued notices to Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for their alleged objectionable remarks during campaigning in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh respectively. The notices state that their remarks violate the model code provision, which requires criticism of other parties to be confined to their policies and programs, and not extend to private aspects of party leaders or be based on unverified allegations.

title: 'Ek Chor-Ek Sipahi': UP cops stumble upon all in a family
description: A thief wanted in over 20 cases of burglary was arrested by Jhansi police, only to find out that his brother is a head constable in UP Police. The cop brother has a clean record and had severed ties with the family long ago. Their father was found to be involved in the crime cases, taking care of stolen cash and jewelry. The arrested thief, Deepak Yadav, has a history of criminal activities, including murders and robberies.

title: NFL: Dawson Knox's injury puts Buffalo Bills' offense in a tight spot
description: Buffalo Bills tight end Dawson Knox has been placed on injured reserve after undergoing wrist surgery. Knox sustained the injury during a Week 5 game and will be sidelined for at least four games. Rookie Dalton Kincaid will step in as the starting tight end in Knox's absence.

title: GI Janes: Women commandos to guard 35 booths in Maoist-hit Bastar division
description: During the first phase of assembly polls in Chhattisgarh, 35 polling stations in the Maoist-hit Bastar division will be guarded by women commandos of Bastar Fighters. Additionally, one booth will be under the watch of transgender police officers. This is the first time that all-women teams are guarding this many booths, and the transgender-guarded booth is a first in Bastar. The move aims to provide more opportunities to women police personnel and promote gender sensitization and equality.

title: Jawan smashes paver block on cop's head over traffic fine
description: A 25-year-old Army jawan was arrested for allegedly attempting to kill a traffic constable in Pune. The jawan, identified as Vaibhav Mangate, had a grudge against the constable who had fined him for a traffic violation a month earlier. Without warning, Mangate hit the constable on the head with a paver block, causing a severe injury. Other traffic constables apprehended Mangate and he was brought to the police station. A case has been lodged against him for attempt to murder and obstructing a public servant from discharging his duties. The injured constable is undergoing treatment at a private hospital.

title: Sensex tanks 901 points to 4-month closing low
description: The Indian stock market, specifically the sensex, experienced a significant drop of 901 points or 1.4% on Thursday, reaching a four-month closing low. This decline is attributed to geopolitical risks and the hardening of US government bond yields. Additionally, the expiration of October derivative contracts and heavy selling by foreign funds have contributed to market volatility. In the last six sessions, the sensex lost 5% of its value, resulting in a loss of investors' wealth amounting to Rs 17.8 lakh crore.

title: Drama in MP as mantri files papers 'to take on' daughter
description: Gaurishankar Bisen, a veteran BJP leader and chairman of the Backward Classes Commission, surprised many by filing his nomination from the Balaghat seat, where the party had already given the ticket to his daughter, Mausam. Bisen claimed that he filed the nomination as a "cover" because Mausam was unwell and out of town. The party denied any change in candidate and said that Bisen filed as a dummy candidate. Balaghat is considered to be Bisen's stronghold where he has never lost an election since 1985.

title: Drama in MP as mantri files papers 'to take on' daughter
description: Gaurishankar Bisen, a veteran BJP leader and chairman of the Backward Classes Commission, surprised many by filing his nomination from the Balaghat seat, where the party had already given the ticket to his daughter, Mausam. Bisen claimed that he filed the nomination as a "cover" because Mausam was unwell and out of town. The party denied any change in candidate and said that Bisen filed as a dummy candidate. Balaghat is considered to be Bisen's stronghold where he has never lost an election since 1985.

title: Stop 'rath prabhari' campaign in poll-bound states, says EC
description: The Election Commission on Thursday directed the central government not to undertake any activities requiring the involvement of its senior officers as 'district rath prabharis' in the proposed 'Viksit Bharat Sankalp Yatra' starting next month in the five poll-bound states until December 5, when the elections are scheduled to be completed. Earlier in the day, the government clarified the yatra will not enter poll-bound states until after the model code of conduct is withdrawn.

title: Qatar court sentences eight Indian ex-Navymen to death
description: Eight former Indian Navy personnel have been sentenced to death by a Qatari court on charges that have not been made public. The men, who were working with a firm involved in training Qatari defense forces, were accused of spying. The Indian government expressed shock at the verdict and said it would raise the issue with Qatari authorities. The case has been marked by secrecy, but media reports suggest the men were accused of passing sensitive information on a Qatari-Italian submarine project to Israel. India had previously raised the issue diplomatically with Qatar.

title: Pollution rising, agencies stop sharing crucial data
description: Two agencies under the Union earth sciences ministry, System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR) and Decision Support System (DSS), have stopped sharing information on sources of pollution in Delhi. Experts have called for transparency, stating that data on sources is crucial in designing strategies against pollution and creating public awareness. The real-time source apportionment study by IIT-Kanpur has also been stalled since October 18 due to a fight between the Delhi government and the bureaucracy. This lack of crucial data hampers efforts to tackle air pollution effectively.

title: Pollution rising, agencies stop sharing crucial data
description: Two agencies under the Union earth sciences ministry, System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR) and Decision Support System (DSS), have stopped sharing information on sources of pollution in Delhi. Experts have called for transparency, stating that data on sources is crucial in designing strategies against pollution and creating public awareness. The real-time source apportionment study by IIT-Kanpur has also been stalled since October 18 due to a fight between the Delhi government and the bureaucracy. This lack of crucial data hampers efforts to tackle air pollution effectively.

title: Aligarh banker forced to transfer Rs 98k, beaten to death later
description: A 24-year-old bank employee in Aligarh was beaten to death by robbers who forced him to make an online transfer of Rs 98,000. The victim's body was found near the Pilibhit-Madhotanda road. Seven people have been arrested in connection with the crime. The accused admitted to beating the victim to death with sticks and bricks after forcing him to transfer the money. They accosted the victim when he was walking alone and snatched his bag before demanding the transfer. The accused have been charged with murder and conspiracy.
